name: Kubestash Alerts SOP.txt - Dashboards
description: This section provides links to Grafana dashboards for monitoring the Kubestash service in the Stage and Production environments. These dashboards offer a visual representation of various metrics and performance indicators related to Kubestash, allowing users to monitor the health and status of the service in real-time.
use_cases: Monitoring the performance and health of the Kubestash service
Identifying and troubleshooting issues or bottlenecks in the Kubestash service
Analyzing historical data and trends related to Kubestash
Proactive monitoring and alerting for potential issues or anomalies

name: Kubestash Alerts SOP.txt - Action Steps
description: This section outlines the steps to troubleshoot and resolve alerts related to failed jobs in the Kubestash cluster. It involves identifying the affected cluster, checking the status of the Kubestash namespace and cron jobs, analyzing logs to find the root cause, and deleting the failed jobs to resolve the alerts.
use_cases: Monitoring and alerting for failed jobs in Kubestash clusters
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Kubestash cron jobs
Analyzing logs to identify root causes of job failures
Cleaning up failed jobs to resolve alerts

name: Kubestash Alerts SOP.txt - Coralogix Index for logs verification
description: This section provides links to the Coralogix log indexing service for verifying logs related to the Kubestash application across different Kubernetes clusters and environments like ops-common, prod-green-eks, prod-white-eks, cde-blue, and cde-green. The links include filters to view logs from the Kubestash namespace and various log severity levels (Debug, Verbose, Info, Warning, Error, Critical) for the past 24 hours. It also mentions reporting any errors related to AWS resource access to the leads or security team immediately.
use_cases: Monitoring and troubleshooting Kubestash application logs across multiple Kubernetes clusters and environments
Identifying and investigating errors or issues related to AWS resource access
Analyzing log patterns and trends for different severity levels
Auditing and compliance purposes by reviewing historical logs
capabilities: Filtering logs by cluster, namespace, and severity level
Viewing logs for a specific time range (past 24 hours)
Sharing log query links with permalink
Alerting and reporting for critical issues
